Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Location

Brussels

Job Description

Do you want to belong to one of the most advanced Data Science groups in the industry, developing advanced AI, ML and optimization algorithms, and applying Operations Research techniques?

Do you have passion for technology and desire to learn and grow continuously?

A career in IT Data Science & Analytics at P&G will build your Data Science and Analytics skills, develop your ability to influence and think strategically and will provide you a breadth of experience across multiple internal businesses and type of work (whether you do Analytics for Marketing, Sales, Supply Chain).

As a Data Scientist for the Supply Chain you will belong to an award-winning Analytics / Operations Research community that is global in scope, and operates across P&G’s supply chains.

Find out more about IT at P&G at www.youtube.com/watch?v=1ial3aeA9SE .

Your Contribution To P&g’s Success

Our Data Scientists in IT Data & Analytics at P&G are:


Passionate about Analytics: the ability to mine terabytes of data, develop models and algorithms to derive actionable insights, and then translate those insights into business is important in our work. In this role you will provide consulting services to P&G business units in Europe, India, Middle East and Africa; you will use mathematical modelling, decision analysis and simulation to provide business insights to various aspects of the supply network (supply chain design, inventory modelling, capacity analysis, distribution flow and purchasing analytics). You will get to know a wide variety of supply chains and you will influence multi million-dollar decisions. You will act as primary enthusiast for the power of technology, data, and predictive and prescriptive analysis.
Effective communicators, self-driven and able to drive insights into actions that improve business results. Interpersonal and communication skills are crucial to thrive in a multi-functional leadership team. Your job is to communicate complex data or algorithms into simple conclusions that will empower others to act based on the insights you derive.
Technically Capable: Data Scientists “roll up their sleeves”, using data visualization (Spotfire, Tableau), and analytic tools (R, Python, SAS, JMP, Hive/Impala, etc.) to grasp the business building insights in our mountains of data. You should be adept at applying such technologies for solving ad hoc business problems, innovating on potential future solutions, and working with technology partners to translate your innovations into robust, scaled, analytic solutions.


Job Qualifications

YOU ARE THE RIGHT FIT IF YOU ARE/HAVE:


A Master in a quantitative degree (Operation Research, Statistics, Systems Engineering, Decision Sciences, Computer Science, Applied Math, Economics etc.);
English fluency;
Strong technical & analytical skill (R, SAS, SQL, optimization, simulation, predictive modeling etc);
Great leadership skills, problem solving and priority setting;
Excellent collaboration skills and working comfortably across teams;
have passion to transform how decisions are made through adhoc & scaled application of analytics;
preferably have some experience in CPG (FMCG), supply chain, analytics or consulting; can demonstrate success at deriving insight from data and effectively communicating those insights to drive action.


Your Advantages


A fixed contract, with an attractive compensation package;
Competitive pay, including monthly salary, 13th month at the end of the year as well as an annual variable bonus.
A flexible benefits plan to customize to your personal needs and kilometer allowance/public transport reduction;
Hospitalization plan after 6 months of employment, pension plan, life insurance plan, long term illness insurance and stock purchase plan;
Access to Benefits at work platform: A large benefits platform with employee discounts on renowned shops and online commercial platforms as well as on leisure activities and well-known amusement parks;
Working in an international and inclusive environment, with diverse and supporting colleagues.
Continuous self-development via coaching, trainings and a general Growth Mindset working environment;
A vibrant and modern working environment, supporting employees’ wellbeing:
Subsidized company restaurant;
On-site vibrant Café for breaks and less formal meetings;
On-site fitness room and possibility to join regular group sport activities;
Flexibility in terms of working hours and remote working for a good balance between personal needs and the job to be done.
Employee Assistance Program: free professional counseling services, work-life resources, and mental health support.
Supporting employees’ commute: plenty of parking facilities for both cars and bikes, shower facilities, shuttle between Heizel metro and the office, carpooling community.


ARE YOU EXCITED ABOUT THE ROLE? DEEP DIVE INTO P&G AND CHECK THE BELOW INSIGHTFUL LINKS:


Our hiring process consists of three main steps: 1) application, 2) online assessments and 3) interviews. Click here to get all the tips to be fully prepared.
P&G is driven to make life better, not just within the company, but across the globe. Click here to check out how we make a meaningful impact on the world.
We are the world’s largest consumer goods company. Click here to discover about our iconic brands.


At P&G #weseeequal

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. At P&G, we strive to build a culture where everyone feels welcome, included, and able to bring their full selves to work.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process. Please click here if you require an accommodation during the application process. Please make sure to wait to hear back from us regarding your accommodation before proceeding with the online assessment, we thank you in advance for your patience.

Title: Junior Data Scientist (B2B SaaS in Brussels)
Description:
Join Novable, a pioneering force in corporate innovation. We connect startups with the industrial power of corporations to drive meaningful transformation.

Goal

Grow and maintain our cutting-edge database of innovative companies. Improve our Deep Matching technology to match the right startups with client needs.

Key Responsibilities


Work on R&D projects to improve smart crawlers through the use of LLM Agents
Develop efficient data processing pipelines
Develop evaluation processes for quality improvement
Improve our Deep Matching algorithm


Environment


Be part of a forward-thinking company with an inspiring mission to connect innovation with industrial power for global transformation.
Grow your skills by tackling challenging projects with real business impact.
Enjoy a fun work environment in Brussels, surrounded by passionate professionals committed to making an impact.


Profile


Strong Python skills
Familiar with MySQL and MongoDB
Passionate about generative AI and machine learning techniques
Familiar with Python API frameworks: Django, Flask, …
You love to solve problems, you can troubleshoot complex issues
Fun to work with, we take the sense of humour very seriously
Perfectly fluent in EN
Bonus: experience with AWS or other cloud provider


NOVABLE VISION: ENABLE INNOVATION THROUGH STARTUP RELATIONS

Novable is a tech startup active in the corporate innovation space, providing a startup scouting solution made of advanced technology software and dedicated analyst reviews. In particular, Novable develops an advanced AI-based technology to scout and match startups.

Startups have the innovation power - We believe that startup ecosystems (entrepreneurs, startups, scaleups, hubs, accelerators, venture capital funds) are a glimpse of the future, as they crystallize the forefront of technology innovation everywhere in the world. They are the crystal ball to anticipate future industry trends.

Corporations have the industrial power - On the other side, we believe that corporations have the necessary resources to get things done and to put the best ideas at work on a global scale. In that sense, it is critical that they collaborate with startups, not only for themselves, not only for their survival but also for the greater good of humanity on this planet.

Bring the best of those two worlds together - We are technology optimists. We believe that tech innovation can contribute to solving major societal issues and world problems, provided that enough industrial power is injected into the process. We envision a world where innovation and industry powers connect seamlessly and globally, to speed up the world’s transformation.

Novable mission is to enable innovation through startup relations, by connecting the brightest minds from the startup ecosystem with the strong industrial ambitions of the business world. We allow corporations and companies to identify the most suitable, enterprise-ready innovations matching their strategic agenda.

HTML:
Join Novable, a pioneering force in corporate innovation. We connect startups with the industrial power of corporations to drive meaningful transformation.

Goal

Grow and maintain our cutting-edge database of innovative companies. Improve our Deep Matching technology to match the right startups with client needs.

Key Responsibilities

  • Work on R&D projects to improve smart crawlers through the use of LLM Agents
  • Develop efficient data processing pipelines
  • Develop evaluation processes for quality improvement
  • Improve our Deep Matching algorithm

Environment

  • Be part of a forward-thinking company with an inspiring mission to connect innovation with industrial power for global transformation.
  • Grow your skills by tackling challenging projects with real business impact.
  • Enjoy a fun work environment in Brussels, surrounded by passionate professionals committed to making an impact.

Profile

  • Strong Python skills
  • Familiar with MySQL and MongoDB
  • Passionate about generative AI and machine learning techniques
  • Familiar with Python API frameworks: Django, Flask, …
  • You love to solve problems, you can troubleshoot complex issues
  • Fun to work with, we take the sense of humour very seriously
  • Perfectly fluent in EN
  • Bonus: experience with AWS or other cloud provider

NOVABLE VISION: ENABLE INNOVATION THROUGH STARTUP RELATIONS

Novable is a tech startup active in the corporate innovation space, providing a startup scouting solution made of advanced technology software and dedicated analyst reviews. In particular, Novable develops an advanced AI-based technology to scout and match startups.

Startups have the innovation power - We believe that startup ecosystems (entrepreneurs, startups, scaleups, hubs, accelerators, venture capital funds) are a glimpse of the future, as they crystallize the forefront of technology innovation everywhere in the world. Corporations have the industrial power - On the other side, we believe that corporations have the necessary resources to get things done and to put the best ideas at work on a global scale. In that sense, it is critical that they collaborate with startups, not only for themselves, not only for their survival but also for the greater good of humanity on this planet.

Bring the best of those two worlds together - We are technology optimists. We believe that tech innovation can contribute to solving major societal issues and world problems, provided that enough industrial power is injected into the process. We envision a world where innovation and industry powers connect seamlessly and globally, to speed up the world’s transformation.

Novable mission is to enable innovation through startup relations, by connecting the brightest minds from the startup ecosystem with the strong industrial ambitions of the business world. We allow corporations and companies to identify the most suitable, enterprise-ready innovations matching their strategic agenda.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Description

We are seeking a highly skilled Data Scientist to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will work closely with Product Managers, delivery teams, and Product Design Leads to integrate data-driven insights into dashboards and applications, making analytics more actionable and impactful.


You will leverage cutting-edge analytical techniques and stay informed about emerging trends to drive innovation and continuous improvement.
The ideal candidate is passionate about solving complex problems through data, possesses strong technical skills, and thrives in an agile, collaborative environment.


Responsibilities


Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define data-driven solutions and actionable insights.
Design and develop predictive models, statistical analyses, and machine learning algorithms.
Integrate advanced analytics into applications and dashboards to enhance decision-making.
Use programming languages such as Python and data science libraries (e.g., Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn) to analyze large datasets.
Handle and manipulate data using SQL and tools like BigQuery.
Visualize data effectively using modern data visualization tools to communicate findings clearly.
Continuously evaluate and adopt emerging data science methodologies to improve processes and outcomes.
Proactively challenge the status quo to drive innovation and efficiency within the team.


Technical Skills


data science, data analysis, or data management.
analytical techniques
machine learning
statistical modelling
Python
data handling using SQL and BigQuery
Google Cloud Platform (GCP), AWS, or Azure.

Title: Data Science
Description:
Location: Brussels, Belgium (Hybrid/Remote Options Available)

Employment Type: Freelance/Contract




About the Role

We are looking for a dynamic and skilled Freelance Data Scientist to join our team on a project basis in Brussels. In this role, you will leverage your expertise in machine learning, statistical modeling, and data analysis to deliver actionable insights and innovative solutions for our clients. This is a unique opportunity to work on diverse projects while enjoying the flexibility of a freelance position.




Key Responsibilities

Data Analysis & Modeling: Analyze complex datasets to extract meaningful insights and build predictive and prescriptive models.
Machine Learning: Develop, implement, and optimize machine learning algorithms to solve real-world business problems.
Data Preprocessing: Perform data cleaning, transformation, and feature engineering to prepare datasets for analysis.
Visualization & Reporting: Communicate findings and recommendations through compelling visualizations and detailed reports using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Matplotlib.
Collaboration: Work closely with stakeholders, including data engineers, analysts, and business leaders, to understand project goals and deliver tailored solutions.
Tool Development: Build and deploy data science solutions, including custom scripts, tools, and APIs for client use.
Compliance: Ensure compliance with GDPR and other data privacy regulations while handling sensitive data.




Required Skills and Qualifications

Experience:

Minimum 3–5 years of experience as a Data Scientist, preferably including freelance or consulting roles.
Proven track record of successfully delivering data science projects.
Technical Expertise:
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R, with experience in libraries like Pandas, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, or PyTorch.
Strong knowledge of SQL and experience working with databases.
Expertise in machine learning techniques, including supervised and unsupervised learning, and advanced modeling approaches.
Familiarity with big data platforms and cloud technologies (e.g., AWS, Azure, or GCP).
Experience in natural language processing (NLP) or computer vision is a plus.
Soft Skills:
Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking abilities.
Excellent communication skills to present technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Self-motivated with the ability to work independently and meet deadlines.
Regulatory Knowledge: Understanding of GDPR and best practices for handling sensitive data.




What We Offer

Competitive hourly/daily rates based on experience.
Flexible work arrangements, including hybrid or remote options.
Exciting and impactful projects across various industries.
Access to cutting-edge tools, technologies, and methodologies.
A supportive and collaborative team environment.




How to Apply

Are you passionate about turning data into actionable insights and innovative solutions? We want to hear from you!

Title: ML Engineer - Gen AI
Description:
Are you a passionate Machine Learning Engineer with expertise in generative AI?

In this role, you will collaborate closely with data scientists and engineers from our Cloud and DevSecOps teams to implement best practices and ensure technical excellence across multiple projects. Utilizing open-source frameworks like LangChain and Azure-based tools, including the Azure AI Services suite, you will maintain and expand our repository of AI assets. Your innovative mindset will help identify and develop state-of-the-art solutions that deliver business value, while your commitment to staying current with AI advancements will ensure our team remains at the forefront of technology.

As a member of the Machine Learning Enablers team, you will actively research and develop agent-based AI use cases, focusing on multi-agent systems. Your work will support the day-to-day needs of our data scientists through the practical maintenance and enhancement of AI assets, while also driving innovation in our AI initiatives.

Responsibilities

Develop and Maintain our Generative AI Repository


Manage and expand our repository of reusable Generative AI components on Azure DevOps, ensuring it’s robust, up-to-date, and user-friendly, and implements MLOps standards.
Collaborate with data scientists to identify new components to build, provide technical support, and promote best practices in using the repository.



Develop and Implement Agent-Based AI Solutions


Research and experiment with multi-agent systems and emerging frameworks to address real-world use cases in Proximus’ context.
Develop proof-of-concept projects to validate innovative multi-agent AI applications.
Design and create reusable components that enable data scientists to integrate agent-based approaches into their projects.



Collaborate and Drive Technical Excellence


Implement and promote machine learning best practices (e.g., MLFlow), ensuring high-quality standards across the team.
Stay current with the latest trends, models, and frameworks, and communicate them to the team.



Your Profile


Master’s degree in Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related quantitative field.
A Ph.D. is a plus, especially with research in Generative AI or agent-based systems.
Minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience in a business environment.
Proven experience working with generative AI models and LLMs in real-world projects.
Demonstrated ability to develop proof-of-concept projects, and transition innovative solutions to production-ready components.
Strong collaboration and communication skills, with experience working alongside a diverse team of technical and non-technical stakeholders.



Technical Skills:


Strong coding skills in Python, with proficiency in software development best practices, including version control (e.g., Git) and DevOps (e.g., CI/CD pipelines).
Hands-on experience implementing MLOps best practices (e.g., experiment tracking with MLFlow).
Experience with Microsoft Azure and Azure AI Services.
Experience with LangChain and other Generative AI frameworks.
Ability to drive innovation by experimenting with new techniques and frameworks to solve real-world problems.
Familiarity with Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) architectures and improvement techniques.
Strong communication skills for providing technical support, mentorship, and clear guidance to team members.
Strong collaboration skills and ability to manage tasks independently.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with keen attention to detail.
Experience contributing to the development of reusable AI components or libraries, contributions to open-source AI projects is an asset.
Experience with multi-agent systems and related frameworks (e.g. LangGraph, CrewAI, AutoGen).
Familiarity with monitoring and evaluation tools for generative AI applications.



Languages


Fluent in English and preferably also French and/or Dutch.



Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Are you looking to make a measurable impact for your clients with data science?

Ready to expand your skillset in different tools, methodologies, and across various industries?

Do you have an innate passion for business and entrepreneurial sense while having an interest in the technical aspects of the job?

🎯 What is your mission?

Help innovative companies thrive in turning their objectives into results, through smarter use of data.

✅ More concretely, what will you do day-to-day?

As a Data Scientist, you will play a vital role in the end-to-end delivery of our projects.

Therefore, you will work closely with stakeholders to:


Prioritize business requirements
Manage data collection
Analyze results
Provide reports
Model data
Interpret trends and patterns
Communicate the results and next steps effectively with clients


Our assignments include:


Data audit
Data preparation
Descriptive analysis
Modeling
Presenting the results


Senior Data Scientists supervise and coach junior Data Scientists in delivering their projects and on internal tasks. This guidance is to help junior Data Scientists acquire the business and technical skills to manage their projects quickly.

Requirements

👤 Do you recognize yourself?

🎓 Your Background


You have a master's in Management/Economics, Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Biology, or similar - There is no standard study background for data
You are fluent in English and either in Dutch OR French



💼 Your Professional Skills


You have good knowledge and demonstrable experience with ETL and statistical packages (SAS, SPSS, R, Python, Spark). Knowledge of programming languages such as Javascript, Spark, S, C is a plus.
You have technical expertise in data preparation, data models, data mining, and segmentation



🤓 Your Personal Skills


You have strong analytical skills to collect, organize, analyze, and interpret large amounts of data to underline the relevant information regarding a specific business objective
You have a problem-solving mindset; you take a pragmatic approach regarding data science and seek out the simple solution



⚠️ Must Have


You are eligible to work in Belgium and the European Union (please be aware that we do not offer relocation support)



🤗 You will be a great fit if -


You want to be among the first employees to help us shape our organization and grow in the future.
You have a natural care about work quality, showing a professional attitude and passion for service. You are proactive, autonomous, and like to take initiative
You can confidently interact and communicate at all levels, from the front-line staff to the executive team, with data experts and non-experts alike.
You are curious about new techniques and tools and strive always to keep learning



🙅‍♀️ Some signs this may not be the right fit -


If you don't like to interact with customers or do presentations from time to time. All our Data Scientists are client-facing.
If you are not comfortable working at the client's premises (on average 2-3 days a week) and from our offices in Brussels (on average 1-2 days a week)
If you don't have an entrepreneurial mindset and aren't ready to go the extra mile to deliver quality work or contribute to an organization's growth



Benefits

💜 Working at Agilytic

We aim at creating a work environment that allows you to do exceptional work, grow your skillset and, most importantly, be happy while doing it.

You may work on assignments anywhere in Belgium and neighboring countries like Luxembourg, France, the Netherlands, and the UK. You can expect to interact with IT/data specialists and business executives (marketing, process, customer care).

We believe that data is a means to an end and not an end in itself. We don't use cutting-edge techniques when not suited to the problem we need to solve. We adapt to what the client truly needs, even if it might look less appealing from a technical perspective. For instance, we won't train a neural network predicting marketing performance based on 1000 variables if a simple dashboard showing marketing efficiency across a few dimensions answers the customer's question. All our missions are about data, and so far, approximately 50% of them haven't required any machine learning.

Salary And Benefits


💰 Competitive remuneration package: We offer a competitive remuneration package, a cafeteria plan in which you can allocate your variable remuneration to your preferred advantages (extra days off, electronics... and cash of course)
🏋️ Training roadmap: We will draft together a training roadmap, taking into consideration our internal competencies as well as your interests
🤝 Supportive structure and transparency: What we don't have in scale (yet), we'll make it up with flexibility, support, and transparency. We will be there for you every step of the way, with individual coaching and career roadmapping
🧰 Modern tools: Tools are a means to an end. We want them to help you do your best work, not become a bottleneck. That's why you can expect up-to-date hardware and software tools so that you (hopefully) never have to swear at your computer
🥂 Oh, and a little bit of fun too: We take our work very seriously, but we're not afraid to laugh at ourselves. Life is too short

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Description

Your expertise in data analysis, machine learning, and AI will drive impactful innovations that solve real-world problems and transform our business operations. With a flexible work environment and a commitment to fostering continuous learning and professional growth, this role is ideal for passionate professionals who thrive at the intersection of technology and data-driven insights.

Key Responsibilities


Design, develop, and deploy predictive models and machine learning algorithms to address critical business challenges and optimize performance.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including software engineers, product managers, and business analysts, to integrate data science solutions into AI-driven applications and systems.
Utilize advanced programming skills in Python, R, or similar languages to streamline data processing, model development, and deployment workflows.
Implement and refine state-of-the-art machine learning models, ensuring scalability, reliability, and alignment with business objectives.
Conduct in-depth exploratory data analysis (EDA) to identify patterns, trends, and correlations that drive innovation and operational improvements.
Oversee data preprocessing, cleaning, and transformation processes to ensure high-quality, consistent datasets for analysis and modeling.
Create visually compelling dashboards, reports, and presentations to effectively communicate complex findings to both technical and non-technical audiences.


Required Skills And Experience


A proven track record (3+ years) in data science, analytics, or machine learning roles with tangible business impact.
Proficiency in statistical programming languages such as Python and R, along with experience in SQL for database management and queries.
Deep understanding of machine learning techniques, frameworks, and libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn).
Strong analytical skills with expertise in statistical modeling, hypothesis testing, and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, or Matplotlib).
Experience in handling and analyzing large datasets using cloud platforms like AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure.
Demonstrated ability to lead projects, manage timelines, and deliver high-quality results under tight deadlines.


Educational Qualifications


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related discipline.


Hiring Team Member

Avula Srivalli

Recruitment Coordinator


LinkedIn
Mail
Show more

  • Implement and refine state-of-the-art machine learning models, ensuring scalability, reliability, and alignment with business objectives.
  • Conduct in-depth exploratory data analysis (EDA) to identify patterns, trends, and correlations that drive innovation and operational improvements.
  • Oversee data preprocessing, cleaning, and transformation processes to ensure high-quality, consistent datasets for analysis and modeling.
  • Create visually compelling dashboards, reports, and presentations to effectively communicate complex findings to both technical and non-technical audiences.

Required Skills And Experience

  • A proven track record (3+ years) in data science, analytics, or machine learning roles with tangible business impact.
  • Proficiency in statistical programming languages such as Python and R, along with experience in SQL for database management and queries.
  • Deep understanding of machine learning techniques, frameworks, and libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn).
  • Strong analytical skills with expertise in statistical modeling, hypothesis testing, and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, or Matplotlib).
  • Experience in handling and analyzing large datasets using cloud platforms like AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure.
  • Demonstrated ability to lead projects, manage timelines, and deliver high-quality results under tight deadlines.

Educational Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related discipline.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Job Description

We are seeking a skilled and experienced Machine Learning Engineer to design, develop, and deploy advanced machine learning models and frameworks. The ideal candidate will collaborate with cross-functional teams to build scalable ML solutions and optimize real-time data-driven applications, ensuring high accuracy, efficiency, and reliability.

Responsibilities


Develop, deploy, and maintain a robust Machine Learning (ML) platform using cloud frameworks to standardize and democratize ML model utilization across the organization securely and efficiently.
Design and implement advanced ML models to support event-driven, streaming, real-time, and low-latency applications.
Continuously monitor, optimize, and update ML models to ensure accuracy, reliability, and peak performance.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into scalable, reusable ML solutions.
Stay informed about emerging ML trends and technologies, suggesting and implementing innovative practices to keep the company at the forefront of the ML field.
Communicate complex ML concepts effectively to various stakeholders, ensuring clarity across different levels of seniority and technical expertise.


Qualification


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, or a related field.
5+ years of experience developing and deploying ML models, including building online feature stores for real-time, low-latency applications.
Hands-on experience with AWS SageMaker and cloud-based ML environments.


Technical Skills


Machine Learning model development and deployment
Online feature store implementation
Cloud frameworks
Real-time data analytics
ML frameworks
MLOps tools and practices


Soft Skills


Strong communication skills for both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Proactive approach to staying updated with industry trends
Team collaboration and stakeholder management

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Sciensano verbindt gezondheid, wetenschap en samenleving en telt meer dan 900 medewerkers die zich elke dag opnieuw inzetten voor de gezondheid van mens en dier. Zoals uit onze naam blijkt, vormen wetenschap en gezondheid de kern van ons bestaan. De kracht van Sciensano ligt in de holistische en multidisciplinaire benadering van gezondheid. Onze aandacht gaat daarbij uit naar het nauwe en onlosmakelijke verband tussen de gezondheid van mensen en die van dieren, en hun omgeving (het “One health” concept). Daarom combineren we meerdere invalshoeken in ons onderzoek om op een unieke manier bij te dragen aan ieders gezondheid. Sciensano kan hiervoor verder bouwen op de meer dan 100 jaar wetenschappelijke expertise van het voormalige Centrum voor Onderzoek in Diergeneeskunde en Agrochemie (CODA) en het vroegere Wetenschappelijk Instituut Volksgezondheid (WIV). Voor meer informatie over onze projecten en activiteiten : https://www.sciensano.be.


De Sciensano wetenschappelijke dienst “1160: Zorg-gerelateerde infecties en antibioticaresistentie”, biedt de zorginstellingen de nodige hulpmiddelen voor de opvolging van zorginfecties, antibioticumresistentie en het gebruik van antimicrobiële middelen. Met onze onderzoeks- en surveillanceactiviteiten helpen wij de antibioticumresistentie te beperken in acute en chronische zorginstellingen. Wij stellen onze expertise ook ten dienste van de gezondheidsautoriteiten en bieden steun op het terrein bij epidemieën, onder meer gerelateerd aan bacteriën die resistent zijn tegen verschillende antibiotica of SARS-CoV-2.

Binnen de unit “Zorginfecties (ZI)” van vermelde dienst, als “data manager/scientist”, en in samenwerking met de unit lead, ZI-surveillance coördinatoren, Sciensano diensten Healthdata en ICT, de contactpersonen binnen de algemene ziekenhuizen in België, en de stakeholders voor de nationale en internationale ZI preventie- en controle strategie:

  • Bijdragen aan de jaarlijkse organisatie van gegevens-ontvangst, -verwerking, -validatie, -analyse en resultaats-rapportage van ZI surveillances en/of registers “NSIH-DENO”, “NSIH-HOSP”, “NSIH-SEP”, “NSIH-CDI”, “NSIH-SSI”, “NSIH-ICU”, en “ILI_NH”. Voor de vermelde taken en registers, de ontwikkeling en het onderhoud van structurele en reproduceerbare procedures zoals scripts of data-pipelines, en met de voorhanden zijnde hulpmiddelen zoals SAS, R, STATA, MS Excel, en Latex.
  • Instaan voor de jaarlijkse coördinatie van het “NSIH-DENO” register, meer bepaald het onderhoud en de opvolging van het protocol voor nationale gestandaardiseerde gegevensinzameling, van tool(s) voor lokale gegevensverzameling in samenwerking met de dienst Healthdata of ICT, en de operationale gegevens-ontvangst, -validatie, -analyse en resultaats-rapportage indien van toepassing.

Punctuele ondersteuning met betrekking tot de taken van gegevens-ontvangst, -verwerking, -analyse en resultaats-rapportage bij andere projecten binnen de Sciensano wetenschappelijke dienst “1160: Zorggerelateerde infecties en antibiotica resistentie”.


  • Burgerlijk, Bio, of Industrieel Ingenieur, Master in de wiskunde, ICT, statistiek, bio informatica of gelijkwaardig;
  • Goede kennis van en/of ervaring met methoden en tools voor gegevensverwerking, -analyse en resultaats -rapportage, zoals SAS, R, STATA;
  • Goede kennis van en/of ervaring met data integratie-en datastroom concepten en -technieken;
  • Kennis en/of ervaring met datawarehouse concepten, en -technieken bv SQL is een pluspunt;
  • Kennis en/of ervaring met tools voor gegevensverzameling zoals Limesurvey, Redcap, of andere is een pluspunt;
  • Interesse in wetenschappelijk onderzoek, en interesse in volksgezondheid in het algemeen en het domein van zorginfecties in het bijzonder;
  • Goede kennis van het Engels en het Nederlands en/of Frans (voldoende kennis van de andere landstaal);


Een uitdagende functie in een bekend wetenschappelijk instituut.

Arbeidsovereenkomst van bepaalde duur tem 31/12/2025.

Weddeschaal : SW11

Voordelen : gratis abonnement of 100% terugbetaling woon-werkverkeer met het openbaar vervoer; hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering; maaltijdcheques; voordelen via FED+ (www.fedplus.be); andere sociale voordelen.

Andere : glijdende werkuren in een 38-uren week; mogelijkheid tot telewerk en opleidingen.


Stuur je kandidatuur in voor 31/01/2025 via onze website https://www.sciensano.be.


Heb je vragen omtrent deze functie of wens je bijkomende informatie?

Contacteer ons via jobs@sciensano.be.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Requisition ID: 2980

Location:

Louvain-la-Neuve, BE

Work regime: Full-Time

Kind of contract: Open Ended Contract

Mission

The Belgian, B-Corp certified company IBA has opened new ways to diagnose and fight cancer and is the global leader in the field of Proton Therapy, next to its activities in radiopharmaceuticals, industrial sterilization and dosimetry.

Challenges we trust you with

The Data team at IBA focuses on using data to add value to the lives of our customers and colleagues. We value agility, ownership, and we are not afraid to challenge the status quo.

Your mission is to help our business teams with extracting insights from data through statistics and artificial intelligence. You'll use your experience to work closely with our data engineers, data scientists and business domain experts to ensure that your projects deliver tangible value and help build IBA a competitive advantage through data. More concretely, you will contribute to applications for predictive maintenance, as well as demonstrate feasibility in ambitious R&D projects.

We are looking for an experienced data professional who can drive a data project end-to-end. This includes deep diving in the business domain, exploring available data, suggesting improvements for data collection, as well as building, deploying, and monitoring AI models and visualizing the results.

How will your first months look like?

First, you’ll get onboarded on our data infrastructure and get a better understanding of the tools we are using. Next, you’ll be introduced on your first data science challenges.

Must-have

What we value


At least 3 years of relevant experience
Solid foundation in all steps of CRISP-DM
Strong foundation in statistics and AI, through education or experience
Proven experience in delivering AI projects
Motivation to understand our business and integrate our domain knowledge
Strong communicator that can describe complex topics in a simple way
Fluent in English, French is a plus
Passionate about data


Nice To Have


Experience with time series and/or natural language projects
Experience with Databricks and Spark
Experience with predictive maintenance
Experience working in an R&D environment


Cherry on the cake

IBA Offers


Competitive salary and benefits, including a company car
Flexible home office policy (3days/week)
Career growth within a globally recognized leader in medical technology
A supportive team environment that values each member's development
A commitment to cutting-edge technology and solving challenging problems
Be part of a BCorp Certified company, balancing professional innovation with personal well-being


Join us at IBA, where you can be part of a dynamic team working on cutting-edge technology in the fight against cancer. Let's make a difference together!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Are you ready to learn fast and have a real impact in your job?




Join Odoo, a growing software company with an open source product,

a huge global community, as well as a fun and exciting work environment.




We are now looking for a Data Scientist to join our FP&A team. This person will play a strategic role in making the most of transactional data. Our Data Scientist will improve efficiency, anticipate risks, and make informed decisions to optimize commercial and financial operations.




We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Data Scientist to join our Finance department. As a Data Scientist, you will play a central role in analysing large datasets, identifying patterns, and developing predictive models to enhance our FP&A department.

You will analyse transaction data, such as purchases, payments or transfers, to detect trends and patterns. Another key role is to optimise transaction processes to improve efficiency. For example, by analysing processing times, bottlenecks or transaction failure rates, you will suggest adjustments to smooth operations and reduce costs.

You'll build cash flow or revenue forecasting models based on historical transaction trends. These forecasts will help Odoo to better manage their budget and anticipate their cash flow needs. You'll monitor transaction performance, in terms of success rate, turnaround time, and customer satisfaction. Thanks to these analyses, Odoo will be able to adjust its strategies to improve the overall performance of its transactional services.

Your work will directly impact our ability to deliver secure, efficient, and optimized analysis within our company.




Programming Languages: Python
Database: SQL
Machine learning models: regression, classification, clustering
Framework: Odoo (ORM, Workflows, Report Engine, BI, AI)







Responsibilities:

Create complex and custom data models in Odoo, often working with financial, accounting, and other enterprise data. Compile, normalize, and analyse disparate datasets to help solve problems.
Help improve efficiency in processing large quantities of data by automating repeatable processes
Perform advanced querying techniques in SQL (and other database languages) to profile, summarize, make sense of, and trace information across systems
Assist with drafting reports, presentations, and other deliverables to create dashboards in Odoo to present analytics-driven insights to internal teams
Communicate effectively to all levels of engagement management and externally







Must Have

Master Degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field
1+ year of experience in data science, with a focus on the transaction services
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or SQL
Good Communication
Attention to Detail
Team Player: Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and contribute to the success of cross-functional projects
Excellent command of English







Nice to have

Experience in the financial services or transaction services industry
Demonstrated experience in programming or contributing to large codebases
Knowledge of statistical methods, data mining, and predictive analytics
Familiarity with regulatory requirements and compliance standards in the transaction services industry
Knowledge of transaction processing systems, or financial services is highly desirable

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
AI/ML Engineer - LLM Optimization Startup - £120k +equity – Remote (UK/EU)




Are you an AI/ML Engineer with experience in optimizing LLMs?




Do you have experience in improving AI systems’ performance? If so, we have the perfect opportunity for you.




The challenge

The rise of AI has skyrocketed demand for computational power. However, current solutions are expensive and dominated by large corporations. We're tackling this challenge by leading the development of technology to drive the efficiency and performance of AI models. We’ve built a decentralized marketplace for compute power specifically designed for large language models (LLMs) with billions of parameters.




We started less than a year ago, spinning out of an incubator and have grown to 12 people so far. We’re looking for an AI/ML Engineer to join us in optimizing our platform, identifying bottlenecks and improving the performance of our system.




About you

You’ll have experience evaluating research to identify and implement innovative solutions. Ideally, you’ll have a background in distributed AI/ML, inferencing, or optimisation/quantisation. Prototyping skills are also important, though production-grade expertise isn’t required—our team has specialists to handle that for you.




You’ll have experience with large language models, fine-tuning and training them along with a strong theoretical understanding of how to optimise them. You’ll be familiar with things like parallel training methods and understand how to reduce active parameters, minimise the impact of network bandwidth, define memory footprint impact on compute latency.




What we are looking for is someone with:

A solid background in Foundational NLP
At least 3 years’ experience of hands on developing, training and deploying NLP models
Experience with High Performance Computing (NVIDIA)
Experience with Parallel and/or Distributed computing
Experience implementing solutions from research
Experience fine tuning some of the more recent LLMs (OpenAI, Anthropic, Claude, LLaMA etc)




Academic/Research background in following fields would be big bonus:

Distributed ML
Inferencing
Optimization
Quantization




You’ll be an early member of the team that have secured $2.5 million dollars pre-seed, and will receive equity in the business. You’ll be working remotely, with others in the team being spread across, UK, US (East Coast), Dubai and Europe.




Please note: you must be eligible to work in the UK or EU to be considered for this position.




Interested?

If you think you fit the bill, get in touch by clicking the ‘apply now’ button or get in touch with me by the following:

Email me at mo@mbnsolutions.com
Call me on 02037736498

Show more

  • Email me at mo@mbnsolutions.com
  • Call me on 02037736498

Title: ML Engineer - Gen AI
Description:
Are you a passionate Machine Learning Engineer with expertise in generative AI?




In this role, you will collaborate closely with data scientists and engineers from our Cloud and DevSecOps teams to implement best practices and ensure technical excellence across multiple projects. Utilizing open-source frameworks like LangChain and Azure-based tools, including the Azure AI Services suite, you will maintain and expand our repository of AI assets. Your innovative mindset will help identify and develop state-of-the-art solutions that deliver business value, while your commitment to staying current with AI advancements will ensure our team remains at the forefront of technology.




As a member of the Machine Learning Enablers team, you will actively research and develop agent-based AI use cases, focusing on multi-agent systems. Your work will support the day-to-day needs of our data scientists through the practical maintenance and enhancement of AI assets, while also driving innovation in our AI initiatives.




Responsibilities:




Develop and Maintain our Generative AI Repository.

Manage and expand our repository of reusable Generative AI components on Azure DevOps, ensuring it’s robust, up-to-date, and user-friendly, and implements MLOps standadrs.
Collaborate with data scientists to identify new components to build, provide technical support, and promote best practices in using the repository.

Develop and Implement Agent-Based AI Solutions.

Research and experiment with multi-agent systems and emerging frameworks to address real-world use cases in Proximus’ context.
Develop proof-of-concept projects to validate innovative multi-agent AI applications.
Design and create reusable components that enable data scientists to integrate agent-based approaches into their projects.

Collaborate and Drive Technical Excellence.

Implement and promote machine learning best practices (e.g., MLFlow), ensuring high-quality standards across the team.
Stay current with the latest trends, models, and frameworks, and communicate them to the team.




Your Profile:

Master’s degree in Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related quantitative field.
A Ph.D. is a plus, especially with research in Generative AI or agent-based systems.
Minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience in a business environment.
Proven experience working with generative AI models and LLMs in real-world projects.
Demonstrated ability to develop proof-of-concept projects, and transition innovative solutions to production-ready components.
Strong collaboration and communication skills, with experience working alongside a diverse team of technical and non-technical stakeholders.




Technical Skills:

Strong coding skills in Python, with proficiency in software development best practices, including version control (e.g., Git) and DevOps (e.g., CI/CD pipelines).
Hands-on experience implementing MLOps best practices (e.g., experiment tracking with MLFlow).
Experience with Microsoft Azure and Azure AI Services.
Experience with LangChain and other Generative AI frameworks.
Ability to drive innovation by experimenting with new techniques and frameworks to solve real-world problems.
Familiarity with Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) architectures and improvement techniques.
Strong communication skills for providing technical support, mentorship, and clear guidance to team members.
Strong collaboration skills and ability to manage tasks independently.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with keen attention to detail.
Experience contributing to the development of reusable AI components or libraries, contributions to open-source AI projects is an asset.
Experience with multi-agent systems and related frameworks (e.g. LangGraph, CrewAI, AutoGen).
Familiarity with monitoring and evaluation tools for generative AI applications.
Fluent in English and preferably also French and/or Dutch.

Title: Open Application – Data & AI/ML Roles (Data Scientists, ML Engineers, AI Specialists)
Description:
Ready to shape your career in 2025?




We get it — searching for the perfect tech role can be overwhelming. That's why we're opening our doors to talented data scientists, ML engineers, and AI specialists who want to explore opportunities on their own terms. There is no immediate pressure, just smart career moves when the time is right.




Why partner with Ilmiö Talent Agency?

Our story began in Helsinki in 2021 when our founders realized recruitment could be different - more transparent, more human, and focused on real connections. Since then, we've had the pleasure of working with thousands of tech professionals and great Nordic companies like IONA, Vincit, Biila, Medixine, Aeromon and Cloudriven.




What makes us different?

We actually listen, and we specialize in tech. Our experience in the industry means we understand the world of data and AI, the tools you work with, and the kind of projects that excite you. Whether you're building ML models, developing AI solutions, or working with big data architecture - we take time to understand your expertise and career goals before matching you with opportunities.




Here's how simple it is:

1. Submit your open application through the link below

2. Share your LinkedIn profile and tell us what technologies or roles interest you

3. Get matched with opportunities that actually fit your skills and values

The best part? You'll stay in our talent network for future opportunities, including those exclusive roles that never make it to public job boards.




This is an open application as our client companies are actively seeking data and AI talent. While we may not have an immediate role for you, we want to connect with professionals who are open to exploring new opportunities.




You have the right to manage your data and can request its deletion at any time.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
At WeDoData we are working with a global leader in the Online Gambling / iGaming sector looking to hire a Data Scientist specialized in NLP




Fully remote

60K Euro Mid

80K Euro Senior

Annual bonus of 10-15K







Job Description:




We are seeking an exceptional Data Scientist that with a profound understanding of Large Language Models (LLMs) and a strong background in Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR), with in-depth experience working on various NLP domains such as text summarization, language models, sentiment analysis, named entity recognition, machine translation, question answering, chatbots, speech recognition, and more.

Key responsibilities:




Design, build, and fine-tune large Language Model-based and approaches (e.g., Mixtral, Llama) for natural language understanding and generation tasks.
Train, fine-tune, and optimize Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR) models using our private datasets.
Develop, train, and evaluate custom NLP models for a variety of applications including text summarization, sentiment analysis, named entity recognition.
Conduct data curation, preprocessing, and feature engineering for NLP datasets.
Develop and improve existing pipelines to train, evaluate and deploy ML models.
Continuously monitor system performance, troubleshoot issues, and implement improvements/optimizations.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate NLP solutions into production environments.
Stay updated with the latest trends and advancements in NLP and deep learning.




Required Skills and Qualifications:




Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Strong proficiency in Python, with extensive experience in PyTorch and/or TensorFlow.
Familiarity with NLP libraries such as NLTK, SpaCy, and Hugging Face Transformers.
Proven experience in managing and analysing large text and/or audio datasets.
Strong understanding of foundational DL algorithms.
Experience with unit and integration tests (Pytest) and CICD pipelines.
Experience with data versioning, model management, experiment tracking.
Familiarity with key evaluation metrics and optimization techniques.
Extensive knowledge and hands-on experience in Docker.
Excellent problem-solving, analytical, and communication skills.




Due to licencing restrictions, we are unable to hire candidates from the following locations;




Andorra

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
At WeDoData we are working with a global leader in the Online gambling / iGaming sector who are looking to hire a Data Scientist to join their team.




Fully remote

60K EUR mid

80K EUR senior

10-15k annual bonus




What You Will Do

Design and develop advanced ML algorithms for image, text, audio, and tabular data
Develop and optimize pipelines in Azure to train models across various domains
Implement end-to-end applications in Python, including unit and integration tests
Continuously monitor system performance and troubleshoot issues
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to produce solutions to complex problems
Develop common packages and tools for logging, model inference, and more

Required Qualifications and Experience

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
Strong proficiency in Python, PyTorch, and TensorFlow
Proven experience in managing and analyzing large datasets
Solid understanding of foundational DL algorithms
Expertise in unit and integration tests (Pytest) and CICD pipelines
Experience with data versioning, model management, experiment tracking, key evaluation metrics, and optimization techniques
Extensive knowledge and hands-on experience in Docker
Solid understanding of traditional Computer Vision and classical ML

Nice to Have

In-depth experience with computer vision models for object detection, image classification, and segmentation
Experience with Azure services (ML Studio, Data Factory, Functions, Blob Storage) or equivalent cloud provider services
Knowledge of AWS (Amazon Web Services) services, especially EC2 and S3
Experience with Huggingface Transformers, Elastic Stack, Gitlab CI pipelines
Experience with Prompt Engineering, Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG), LLM frameworks (LangChain, LlamaIndex, Haystack, ...), and fine-tuning LLMs

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Wij zijn op zoek naar een gepassioneerde Machine Learning Engineer die ons helpt het Innovation Lab bij ACA verder uit te bouwen. Iemand die samen met ons wil groeien!




ACA’s Innovation Lab is het nieuwe businessconcept van ACA Group. In ons Innovation Lab groeien innovatieve ideeën uit tot gevalideerde businessconcepten.




Hoe wij (samen)werken

Omdat wij een relatief nieuw team zijn, hanteren we geen ‘business-as-usual’ proces. We werken in een dynamische omgeving die eigenlijk vergelijkbaar is met een start-up binnen een groter geheel. ACA investeert een substantieel deel van haar winst in het “ACA Innovation Lab” zodat er ruimte is om nieuwe ideeën en technologieën af te toetsen.

We hebben bij ACA gekozen voor een proactieve aanpak om innovatie (AI en Machine Learning) bij onze klanten te stimuleren. Dit heeft ons de kans gegeven om samen met onze klanten een aantal nieuwe oplossingen te ontwikkelen door het gebruik van AI en ML.




Waar jij mee aan zal werken (tech & omgeving)

Python & Java
Kubernetes & Kubeflow
AWS / GCP
Jupyter notebooks
Git
Tensorflow
Machine Vision toolkits (YOLO, OpenCV, …)
Wandb
MLFlow




Ben jij de geknipte persoon voor deze rol?

Hard skills

Je hebt minstens 3 jaar relevante ervaring met Machine Learning.
Je hebt ervaring als tech lead in een nieuwe start-up omgeving.
Je hebt een goede kennis van het Engels en/of Nederlands.
Je hebt een goede kennis van software development.
Je flexibel kunnen opstellen in een dynamische werkomgeving. Prioriteiten stellen vormen voor jou dan ook geen probleem.
Ervaring in een test-driven development en Agile omgeving.




Soft skills

Je bezit goede communicatieve vaardigheden.
Je bent een teamplayer, maar je gaat ook graag zelfstandig tewerk.
Je bent proactief ingesteld en gemotiveerd om nieuwe uitdagingen aan te gaan!




Hoe voelt dat, werken bij ACA?

Innovatieve werkomgeving: je werkt met de nieuwste technologie en tools in een omgeving die innovatie uitademt.
Een aantrekkelijk loon, een bedrijfswagen, maaltijdcheques, onkostenvergoeding, MacBook Pro en nog veel meer.
Leren & groeien: bij ACA heeft iedereen een on-the-job coach. Je beschikt over een persoonlijk evolutieplan met een budget voor technische en professionele trainingen en heel wat kansen om bij te leren.
We’ve got your back: we voorzien een uitgebreid gezondheids- en verzekeringsplan om tegemoet te komen aan jouw noden. Het is onze prioriteit om ervoor te zorgen dat onze collega’s gelukkig zijn, o.a. door een goede work-life balans, de juiste tools te voorzien, enzovoort.
Onze unieke bedrijfscultuur: je bent deel van een passioneel en hardwerkend team dat trots is op hun verwezenlijkingen. ACA is een plek waar teamwork, transparantie, kennisdeling en erkenning centraal staan. Trots om ons "Great Place To Work" te noemen!
Jij staat centraal: wij zijn gedreven door onze teamleden waarbij iedereen hun steentje bijdraagt, maar waar plaats is voor heel wat fun. Een fantastisch team werkt niet alleen samen, maar maakt ook samen plezier. Daarom organiseren we heel wat activiteiten binnen en buiten onze kantoren en vertrekken we elk jaar op een spetterend ACA-weekend!

Show more

Title: Applied ML Engineer
Description:
Join an AI-powered platform transforming how creators, filmmakers, and animators craft videos with precise control.




Position: Applied ML Engineer

Location: Remote

Salary: upto €130,000




Key Responsibilities:

Develop and maintain ML pipelines aligned with our product roadmap.
Deploy and optimize GenAI models like Stable Diffusion and GANs.
Collaborate with design and engineering teams to solve unique challenges.
Build scalable, cost-effective APIs for cloud-based models.




Requirements:

Experience with large-scale ML systems and Python/PyTorch.

Title: NLP Engineer
Description:
Job Title: NLP Engineer




Location: Fully Remote (EU)




Salary: €80,000 + Stock Options




About the Company:




Our client, an innovative leader in the AI chatbot space, is seeking an experienced NLP Engineer to join their growing team. They are at the forefront of conversational AI, developing cutting-edge natural language processing (NLP) technologies that enhance user interactions and streamline business operations. This fully remote role offers flexibility to work from anywhere within the EU, with a competitive salary and stock options as part of the package.




Position Overview:




As an NLP Engineer, you’ll play a pivotal role in advancing our client’s AI chatbot capabilities by designing, building, and refining NLP models. You will collaborate with a passionate team of AI experts to improve the chatbot’s understanding and response to natural language, pushing the boundaries of AI-powered conversations. This is an excellent opportunity for an experienced NLP professional looking to work in a fast-growing, tech-forward company that values innovation and excellence.




Key Responsibilities:




Develop and deploy state-of-the-art NLP models for tasks such as text classification, sentiment analysis, and entity recognition.
Improve and optimize the existing NLP frameworks to enhance performance, accuracy, and scalability.
Work closely with data scientists and AI engineers to integrate NLP models into production systems.
Conduct research to stay abreast of the latest trends and innovations in NLP and apply these insights to the development process.
Optimize chatbot algorithms to handle large-scale data and real-time user interactions.
Debug, troubleshoot, and continuously improve NLP models to meet performance benchmarks.




Ideal Candidate:




Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, or a related field.
A minimum of 3 years of experience in NLP, with hands-on expertise in libraries such as Hugging Face, spaCy, or TensorFlow.
In-depth knowledge of machine learning models, transformers, and language models (e.g., GPT, BERT).
Proven experience deploying NLP models in production environments.
Proficiency in Python (additional languages like Java or C++ are a bonus).
A strong passion for NLP, AI, and solving complex problems.




What’s on Offer:




A competitive salary of €80,000 + stock options.
Fully remote work across the EU with flexible working hours.
The opportunity to join a pioneering AI company at a time of rapid growth.
Stock options allowing you to share in the company’s long-term success.
An innovative and collaborative culture focused on cutting-edge AI technologies.




How to Apply: If you're an experienced NLP Engineer ready to take your career to the next level with a dynamic, AI-focused company, we’d love to hear from you!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
RED Global is currently recruiting for a Machine Learning Engineer - AI for our client, a global organisation who undertaking a large complex digital transformation program. They are looking to bring on board an experienced ML Engineer – AI with extensive experience of Machine Learning, Generative AI, Solution architecture and Data Science platforms.

Key responsibilities:

Responsible to define and implement best practices for building, testing, and deploying scalable AI solutions with a strong focus on generative models and LLM.
Design and implement solutions with the use of ML and Generative AI tools and technologies, with a strong focus on end-to-end automation.
Accountable to build and design cloud hosted generative AI solutions.
Work closely with customers to identify issues and support them in implementation of their ML ecosystem.
Develop Solutions to ensure robust and secure data pipelines and infrastructure to support AI model training and deployment.
Stay updated on the latest trends and technologies in Generative AI and Machine Learning.
Lead the evaluation of new AI tools, frameworks, and methodologies.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and Dutch or French with good senior level stakeholder management soft skills and competencies.




Required skills:

4+ years’ experience in designing and building AI solutions.
Hands on expertise in ML techniques, deep learning frameworks, image processing and AI-related technologies including Generative AI.
Previous worked across various cloud platforms such as AWS and Azure.
Must have experience of using data science platforms such as Databricks, AzureML, SageMaker and frameworks such as TensorFlow or similar.
Good knowledge of DevOps, MLOps, DataOps and LLMOps principles.
Native Dutch or French speaker and professional working proficiency in English.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Role: AI Engineer

Location: EMEA - (+ or - 3 hours CET)

Salary: €70,000 - €85,000 base + equity package!




Are you ready to help shape the future of sales technology and be part of an entrepreneurial team in one of Europe's most exciting scale-ups?




Company:

Fast growing start-up who was named one to watch in 2023
Founded in 2020 the company already serves 20k users worldwide with 80% of revenue coming from no-touch product offering
Already working with some of the worlds most recognised brands - AWS, Uber + Google to name a few...
International team of around 50 people, consisting of 18 nationalities and a whole lot of ideas




Role:

Design, develop, and deploy AI-Agents with decision-making capabilities
Build clustering models to extract actionable insights from large datasets of B2B data
Develop and enhance recommender systems for thousands of customers
Work with diverse and complex data sources, ensuring quality and consistency. Implement efficient data pre-processing pipelines for training and evaluation
Continuously experiment, iterate, and improve machine learning models to meet business goals
Optimise models for real-time applications and large-scale deployment. Collaborate with engineering teams to integrate AI models into production systems.




About you:

5+ years of professional experience within Engineering
High proficiency with AI frameworks, Machine Learning algorithm and Python
Demonstrated ability to debug, optimise, and iterate on models
Hands-on experience working with large-scale datasets and distributed systems
Ideally worked in a start-up where ownership and accountability is key!!!
Familiarity with modern collaboration tools: Linear App, Notion, Slack, Figma, Google suite




Sound interesting? Get in touch...

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
***RED – ML Engineer – 12 Months – Fully Remote***




RED Global now has an exciting opportunity for a ML Engineer to join one of our international Clients. Here are some details:




Project Details: -

Role: Senior ML Engineer
Start: ASAP
Capacity: Full-time
Type: Fully Remote
Duration: 12 Months
Language: English
Experience: 4 years or more

Requirements:

Proficient in relational SQL and NoSQL databases.

3+ years of experience developing and deploying machine learning systems into production.

Experienced with Machine and Deep Learning libraries such as Scikit-learn, XGBoost, MXNet, TensorFlow, or PyTorch.

Skilled with big data tools: Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc.

Developed predictive models in a production environment, with expertise in MLOps and model integration into larger scale applications.

Experienced with cloud provider solutions (AWS, GCP, Azure) and knowledgeable in serverless code development.

Working experience with native ML orchestration systems such as Kubeflow, Step Functions, MLflow, Airflow, TFX.

Proficient in object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Java, C++, Scala, etc.

Exposed to GenAI and have a solid understanding of multimodal AI via HuggingFace, Llama, VertexAI, AWS Bedrock, or GPT.

Knowledgeable in data pipeline and workflow management tools.

Expertise in standard software engineering methodology: unit testing, test automation, continuous integration, code reviews, design documentation.

Nice to have: Relevant working experience with Docker and Kubernetes is a big plus.







If this is something that might interest you and would like to know more about this role, then please reply with your updated CV and the best way to contact you to Rgohil@redglobal.com

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Mission

The Belgian, B-Corp certified company IBA has opened new ways to diagnose and fight cancer and is the global leader in the field of Proton Therapy, next to its activities in radiopharmaceuticals, industrial sterilization and dosimetry.

Challenges we trust you with

The Data team at IBA focuses on using data to add value to the lives of our customers and colleagues. We value agility, ownership, and we are not afraid to challenge the status quo.

Your mission is to help our business teams with extracting insights from data through statistics and artificial intelligence. You'll use your experience to work closely with our data engineers, data scientists and business domain experts to ensure that your projects deliver tangible value and help build IBA a competitive advantage through data. More concretely, you will contribute to applications for predictive maintenance, as well as demonstrate feasibility in ambitious R&D projects.

We are looking for an experienced data professional who can drive a data project end-to-end. This includes deep diving in the business domain, exploring available data, suggesting improvements for data collection, as well as building, deploying, and monitoring AI models and visualizing the results.

How will your first months look like?

First, you’ll get onboarded on our data infrastructure and get a better understanding of the tools we are using. Next, you’ll be introduced on your first data science challenges.

What We Value

Must-have:


At least 3 years of relevant experience
Solid foundation in all steps of CRISP-DM
Strong foundation in statistics and AI, through education or experience
Proven experience in delivering AI projects
Motivation to understand our business and integrate our domain knowledge
Strong communicator that can describe complex topics in a simple way
Fluent in English, French is a plus
Passionate about data


Nice to have:


Experience with time series and/or natural language projects
Experience with Databricks and Spark
Experience with predictive maintenance
Experience working in an R&D environment


Cherry on the cake

IBA offers :


Competitive salary and benefits, including a company car
Flexible home office policy (3days/week)
Career growth within a globally recognized leader in medical technology
A supportive team environment that values each member's development
A commitment to cutting-edge technology and solving challenging problems
Be part of a BCorp Certified company, balancing professional innovation with personal well-being


Join us at IBA, where you can be part of a dynamic team working on cutting-edge technology in the fight against cancer. Let's make a difference together!

Title: Growth Data Scientist
Description:
About the Opportunity ✍️

We're on the lookout for a skilled Growth Data Scientist to join our team, where you'll be pivotal in driving business growth and maximising ROI. This is your chance to make a significant impact on our market-leading products, optimising growth initiatives and delivering actionable insights. Join us and be part of an exciting journey to reshape our industry!




What you will do

Provide analytical support to the growth marketing team across all facets of their work, including evaluation of customer acquisition cost, customer spending forecast, and finding an optimal mix of marketing channels.
Maintain and improve our marketing tracking and attribution systems.
Oversee and implement A/B tests and other experiments to drive forward optimization efforts.
Automate attribution and CRM campaign reporting.
Measure and optimise ROI of campaigns.
Leverage and incorporate forecasting or predictive modelling techniques to drive recommendations / actionable insights.
Develop data-driven strategies for acquisition, retention, and expansion.
Build robust data models downstream of backend services and external data sources.
Design, build and scale both internal and external data products, which drive informed decision making; examples include dashboards, reports, models, algorithms, integrations into other product lines.
Communicate complex concepts and findings effectively to technical and non-technical audiences across different teams, including VPs, while ensuring clarity and understanding to drive critical business decisions.




About You

As a Growth Data Scientist you will be expected to be able to independently lead projects from end-to-end, as well as mentor and coach other data analysts on the team. You will be someone who can contribute to our overall approach and standards within the data discipline. You will be proactive in spearheading initiatives to support stakeholders and business partners around the organisation.




What you will need

Experience with mobile measurement platforms and web tracking tools (e.g. Braze, Appsflyer, Adjust, GA360/GA4, Mixpanel, Amplitude, Segment).
Experience working in ROAS performance marketing framework with familiarity with AdTech and incrementality measurement approaches.
Experience with web analytics, web tracking and app tracking.
Advanced SQL, data modelling, and data visualisation tools are second nature to you.
You have a deep understanding of the fundamentals of statistics and probability, including experience in conducting large-scale A/B tests.
You have experience working with growth or product teams on acquisition, retention and campaign optimisations.
You have the versatility and willingness to learn new technologies on the job and adapt quickly to changing priorities within a very dynamic environment..
You are experienced in communicating with cross-functional stakeholders including product managers, engineers, VP & C-level executives.
3-5+ years experience as a growth analyst.




Bonus points if

You have experience working in fintech
You have experience working in start-ups or scale-ups
You have knowledge of cryptocurrency
You have worked with DBT, Google BigQuery, Looker and Python

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
CluePoints is a fast-growing company and the premier provider of Risk-Based Quality Management and Data Quality Oversight solutions to clinical research organizations. Our products utilize advanced statistical and machine learning algorithms to assess the quality of clinical trial data both during and following study execution. At CluePoints, we are looking for people with fresh ideas to keep developing our algorithms and help us to sustain our growth.

Responsibilities

As a member of our Research team:


You develop new machine learning models to enhance the CluePoints web platform and/or to develop new products.
You identify promising ML techniques from scientific literature and assess their viability
You leverage relevant open-source resources and keep yourself up-to-date to new developments in this area
You produce robust and clean python code
You follow ML best practices to keep track of experiments and models
You identify new fields of applications for machine learning and deep learning within CluePoints and contribute to increased adoption of machine learning within the healthcare industry
You stay on the edge of relevant research and help CluePoints to continue increasing its scientific visibility by participating at scientific conferences and publishing in scientific journals


Main Qualifications


Master or PhD in Computer sciences or quantitative fields (maths, physics, ...)
Professional experience in machine learning / data science
Efficient in Python
Good knowledge in at least one deep learning platform like TensorFlow or PyTorch
Experience with code versioning tools such as Git


Preferred Qualifications:


Experience with deep learning and natural language Processing
Experience in supporting deployments of machine learning models
Experience with medical data
Experience in GPU computing


Top reasons to work with us:


Flexibility is part of our DNA and you’ll find at CluePoints you can work 100% from home or choose to come to the office any day (please note that this point only concerns employees located in our office in Belgium).
If you choose to come to the office, you’ll discover a fun atmosphere including a game room (e.g., withkicker, PS4, arcade machine, nerf battles, and our newly added dartboard).
Many activities are organized during the year, such as soccer, team lunches, happy hours, LAN parties, board games nights! We also have running groups, languages lessons, and much more!
You’ll be working within a squad organization offering you ownership on projects, and utilize high quality equipment like powerful laptops and screens.
At CluePoints, learning, training and personal growth are part of the game: you’ll have access to online training materials, certifications sponsored by the company, personal growth plans, and career paths to explore new opportunities.
You’ll work with a fast-growing, multi-disciplinary and international team representing over 20 different nationalities, in an English-speaking working environment.
You’ll have a challenging and rewarding job in an ambitious and fast-paced technology scale-up that has received many national and international awards!
Last but not least, we offer competitive salary and benefits, company car, bonus potential, employee referral program.
Show more
